Package Controller.Gods

Class God

java.lang.Object
Controller.Gods.God
Direct Known Subclasses:
Apollo, Artemis, Athena, Atlas, Demeter, Hephaestus, Hera, Hestia, Minotaur, Pan, Poseidon, Prometheus, Triton, Zeus
public abstract class God
extends java.lang.Object

    • getName

      public abstract java.lang.String getName()
      Returns:
      a constant string containing god's name

      public abstract java.lang.String getDescription()
      Returns:
      a constant string containing god's power description

      public void setPrevIndex​(Index prev)

    • turn

      public void turn​(Match match, CommunicationProxy communicationProxy, Worker worker)
      this method manages the entire turn, from the movement of the worker to the building, taking into account god's power
      Parameters:
      communicationProxy - is the class (not null) with which the game interfaces with the other player and sends messages to
      match - the match that the server is managing
      worker - the worker selected by the player

    • usePower

      public void usePower​(Match match, Worker worker)
      helps using powers in general, for example putting invisible block in the cells when there are to many to put
      Parameters:
      match - the match that the server is managing
      worker - the worker that the player chose to move

    • setup

      public void setup​(Match match, Player player)
      this method is used at the beginning of the match to prepare the game board io order to use the power of gods, for example putting the invisible blocks in every cell
      Parameters:
      match - the match that the server is managing
      player - the player whose god's power has to be set

    • resetPower

      public void resetPower​(Match match, Worker worker)
      delete all the workers from the invisible blocks managed by the current player when his god's power ends
      Parameters:
      match - the current match
      worker - the worker selected by the player

    • whereToMove

      public java.util.ArrayList<Index> whereToMove​(Match match, Worker worker, Index index)
      allows you to know where you could move a worker if it was in a specific cell, taking forbiddenMove-blocks into account
      Parameters:
      match - the current match
      worker - the worker selected by the player
      index - the index where you imagine the worker is
      Returns:
      the list of indexes of the cells where the worker can moves

    • whereToBuild

      public java.util.ArrayList<Index> whereToBuild​(Match match, Worker worker, Index index)
      allows you to know where you could build with a worker if it was in a specific cell, taking forbiddenMove-blocks into account
      Parameters:
      match - the current match
      worker - the worker selected by the player
      index - the index where you imagine the worker is
      Returns:
      the list of indexes of the cells where the worker can builds

    • canMove

      public java.lang.Boolean canMove​(Match match, Worker worker)
      allows you to know if you can end the turn with the selected worker
      Parameters:
      match - the current match
      worker - the worker selected by the player
      Returns:
      true if you can end the turn with the worker

    • checkWin

      public java.lang.Boolean checkWin​(Match match, Worker worker)
      checks win condition of the worker which has just been moved
      Parameters:
      match - not null
      worker - not null
      Returns:
      true if a winning condition is verified, taking the power of god into account

    • correctIndex

      public Index correctIndex​(Match match, Index index)
      take from the view a two-dimensional index with no Z info and convert it into a three-dimensional index, according to the current game board
      Parameters:
      match - the current match
      index - the index from the view
      Returns:
      the correct index for the match
